docs.title: Qurat ul ain Ali
docs.text:
I am a Senior Software Engineer with over 11 years of experience in software development, specializing in web-based model-driven engineering (MDE) tools. My work focuses on building scalable, collaborative, and user-friendly modeling platforms using technologies such as Eclipse GLSP and Sirius Web

Previously, I worked as a KTP Research Associate with Rolls-Royce and the University of York, where I led the development of a web-based model engineering environment that improved efficiency and usability in complex engineering workflows.

Before that, I was a PhD researcher and Research Associate at the University of York, focusing on model-driven software engineering as part of the EU-funded Lowcomote Training Network. With a strong background spanning academia and industry, I’m passionate about delivering high-impact software solutions that bridge cutting-edge research with real-world engineering challenges.

• Automated Software Engineering (ASE) 2025 in Seoul, South Korea, as an Attendee in November 2025.
  • Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS) 2025 in Michigan, United States (Virtual), as an Attendee in October 2025.
  • Internation Conference of Software Engineering (ICSE) 2025 in Ottawa, Canada, as an Attendee in May 2025.

• High Integrity Software Conference (HISC) 2024 in UK, presented poster in Oct 2024.
  • MODELS 2024 in Linz, Austria as a Speaker in Sep 2024.

• MDENet Annual Symposium 2023 in London, UK as a Speaker in Dec 2023.
  • MODELS 2023 in Vasteras, Sweden as an Attendee in Oct 2023.
  • SLE 2023 in Lisbon, Portugal as a Speaker in Oct 2023.
  • ECMFA 2023 in Leicester, UK as an Attendee in Jul 2023
  • MODELSWARD 2023 in Lisbon, Portugal as an Attendee in Feb 2023.

• SLE 2022 in Auckland, New Zealand as a Speaker in Dec 2022.
  • MODELS 2022 in Montreal, Canada as a Student Volunteer in Oct 2022.
  • ECMFA 2022 in IMT Atlantique, Nantes, France as an Attendee in Jul 2022.

• MODELS 2021 in Fukuoka (Virtual) as a Speaker in Oct 2021.
  • SAM 2021 in Fukuoka (Virtual) as a Speaker in Oct 2021.

• MODELS 2020 in Montreal, Canada (Virtual) as a Speaker in Oct 2020.
  • ICSE 2020 in Seoul, South Korea (Virtual) as a Student Volunteer in Jul 2020.

docs.title: Reviewing Activity
docs.text:
• Junior Shadow PC at MSR 2026 at Rio de Janeiro, Brazil,in April 2026.
  • Artifact Reviewer at MODELS 2022 at Montreal, Canada in Oct 2022.
  • Reviewed an article in an Open Access Journal known as "Software X"

Note

I will be happy to provide my services to review any software modelling related articles.

• Ionut Predoaia, Qurat Ul Ain Ali, Dimitris Kolovos, Antonio García-Domínguez. 2024 "Semi-automated migration of domain-specific graphical editors to the Web" In High Integrity Software Conference 2024
  • Qurat Ul Ain Ali, Dimitris Kolovos, Antonio Garcia-Dominguez, Michael Bennett, Joe Newton, Piotr Zacharzewski "Advancing Domain-Specific High-Integrity Model-Based Tools: Insights and Future Pathways" In ACM/IEEE 27th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems (MODELS ’24), September 22–27, 2024, Linz, Austria [PDF]

• Qurat ul ain Ali, "Optimisation of Model Management Programs Using Automated Program Rewriting". Dec 2023 [PDF]
  • Qurat ul ain Ali, Dimitris Kolovos, and Konstantinos Barmpis. 2023. "Towards Efficient Model Comparison using Automated Program Rewriting". In Proceedings of the 16th ACM SIGPLAN International Conference on Software Language Engineering (SLE ’23)[PDF]

• Qurat ul ain Ali, Dimitris Kolovos, Konstantinos Barmpis "Identification and Optimisation of Type-Level Model Queries" (Best Paper) at SAM 2021 co-located with MODELS. [PDF]

  • Qurat ul ain Ali, Benedek Horvath, Dimitris Kolovos, Konstantinos Barmpis, Akos Horvath "Towards Scalable Validation of Low-Code System Models: Mapping EVL to Viatra Patterns" at 2nd Low-Code Workshop at MODELS 2021. [Slides][PDF]
• Qurat ul ain Ali, Dimitris Kolovos, Konstantinos Barmpis. "Efficiently Querying Large-Scale Heterogeneous Models" at 1st Low-Code Workshop at MODELS 2020. [PDF]
• Qurat ul ain Ali, Muhammad Haroon Yousaf. "Role of Spatio-Temporal Feature Position in Recognition of Human Vehicle Interaction" at Tencon 2018
